definition: to make new advances/to move forwards

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate

sentences.english: It is time to try something new!
sentences.chinese: 現在是推陳出新的時候了。

sentences.english: He backed the costs of the new play.
sentences.chinese: 他同意承擔這出新戲的費用。

sentences.english: It's little surprise then that there's not much incentive for retailers and e-tailers to challenge the status quo.
sentences.chinese: 零售商和網售商挑戰出新的動機不大，一點也不奇怪。

sentences.english: The test code at the bottom then sets the value and prints out the new value.
sentences.chinese: 底部的測試代碼設置值並打印出新值。

sentences.english: It is interesting that their antlers are lost every year and new ones grow the next year.
sentences.chinese: 有趣的是，鹿角每年脫換一次，第二年又長出新的來。

sentences.english: People are thronging to see his new play .
sentences.chinese: 人們成羣結隊地去看他那出新戲。

sentences.english: Political pop has a new face in Yin Kun' s oils.
sentences.chinese: 政治通俗畫在尹坤的油畫中呈現出新的面貌。

sentences.english: Click on the Science section to reveal a new passage.
sentences.chinese: 科學節上點擊，呈現出新的通道。

sentences.english: The flowers cross-pollinated creating a new plant species.
sentences.chinese: 花朵異花授粉而創造出新植物品種。

sentences.english: White supremacists devise new methods to disenfranchise Negroes.
sentences.chinese: 白人至上論者想出新的方法以剝奪黑人的公民權。

sentences.english: Jngfang unceasingly send out new life energy in practice.
sentences.chinese: 經方在實踐中不斷煥發出新的生命力。

sentences.english: Buy flowers, she is at it again, she happily between two people.
sentences.chinese: 買花失利，周母再出新招，她樂此不疲地撮合兩人。

sentences.english: Yuanmingyuan, I hope that I can create a miracle, to create a new you.
sentences.chinese: 圓明園，希望我能夠創造奇蹟，製造出新的你。

sentences.english: Another day, another new feature in Gmail Labs.
sentences.chinese: Gmail研究室又一次研發出新功能。

sentences.english: Some bloggers even took the chance to send New Year wishes to Hu.
sentences.chinese: 有些用戶甚至藉此機會向胡錦濤主席送出新年祝福。

sentences.english: An old dog cannot learn new tricks.

definition: to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
abreast of modern developments/to keep up with the times/progressive/timely
(after a verb, indicates coming out, completion of an action, or ability to discern or detect)
to replace the old with new/to renew/to renovate/to upgrade/to update/to regenerate
